snippet: The water just below a Colorado mine that poured three million gallons of toxic waste into nearby waterways has returned to pre-spill levels of toxicity, officials said.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency officials say water underneath Colorado mine affected by three million gallon toxic waste spill has reverted to pre-spill levels of toxicity; caution spill's path will need to be studied for years to understand its full effect.
lead_paragraph: The water just below a Colorado mine that poured three million gallons of toxic waste into nearby waterways has returned to pre-spill levels of toxicity, officials said.

headline.main: Colorado: Water Near Mine at Pre-Spill Toxicity
headline.print_headline: Colorado: Water Near Mine at Pre-Spill Toxicity
